page.title: 10MARSTON MILL FARM, COVENTRY.
page.content: Marston Mill Farm has 94 acres between Wolston and Bretford on the south side of River Avon. The Water Mill on site is mentioned in the Domesday Book. Last Mill demolished in 193O's. It is a dairy farm with 72 cows. All the land is grass except 8 and a half acres of turnips for summer grazing. Cows are Friesians and Holstiens milk yield 700 to 1600 litres per day according to season. Protein pellets and brewery waste are also fed. There is a large modern milking parlour for 16 cows. The farmer runs the farm alone. He knows all the cows and does not keep records. Milking takes 2 hours. There is no bull. Artificial insemination from champion stock costs Â£15. Best calves kept to restock herd.Biggest problems- waste disposal and falling milk cosumption.
